name: Music Machine
overview: Music Machine Cartridge for the Commodore Max Machine. It allows you to produce music on the MAX Machine's SID chip (same one as the Commodore 64). Some history: the MAX Machine was a game machine developed prior to the Commodore 64 and sold only in Japan. Commodore made about 25 cartridges for the MAX machine, but since the system was largely a flop, few were produced and the cartridges are hard to find today. Because the Commodore 64 was designed with a MAX emulation mode, all MAX cartridges also work on the Commodore 64, SX64, and Commodore 128. Some were slightly repackaged and later sold in C64 markets.
